message.content:
An apple is a fruit that grows on deciduous trees from the Rosaceae family.
Its color can range from green to yellow to red, with a smooth or slightly bumpy texture.
The shape of an apple is generally round, often with a slight bulge on one end where it was attached to the tree.
Apples are commonly found in grocery stores, farmers markets, and orchards.
They are often eaten raw as a snack or used in cooking and baking.
Apples are a good source of dietary fiber and various vitamins and minerals.
They have a crisp, juicy texture when fresh and can be stored for several weeks in a cool environment.
